result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abigail Lea Otteson

records.addlTxt: Completion of Representation - Att De La Rosa
Court's response to 07/01/2022 Clerk's note
Clerk's Note to the Court RE: Unsigned Cash Bond

[ma] Cases 21CF293 & 22CF131 called at 11:13am 
Defendant Abigail Lea Otteson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 21CF293; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Remaining Counts of Case 21CF293 and Case 22CF131

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Count #1 of Case 21CF293, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to serve 6 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH; transfer is authorized but no use of electonic monitoring/passive sentence. 
---Ms. Otteson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $50 drug testing fee

2 days sentence credit
recess:11:40am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

On the above date, the Court ordered the Defendant post a $50.00 Cash Bond and sign an amended bond. Due to an oversight whole at was at the counter, I did not administer the amended despite the Defendant posting $50.00. A Clerk's note was generated on 07/01/2022 and sent to the Court for review RE: how to apply the $50.00 intended for the Cash Bond. - ML
This Bond applies to cases #21CF293 and #22CF131. Ms. Otteson is required to post this bond by 4:00pm on June 23, 2022.

[MK] cases #21CF293, #22CF131 called at 12:25pm  
Defendant Abigail Lea Otteson in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court quashes the imposed and stayed Warrants. . 
Attorney De La Rosa requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing.  
Arguments are given on the State's request for consideration of a cash bail requirement. 
The Court requires a $50 Cash Bond (applies to both cases) to be posted by 4:00pm today. 
The Court removes the Jury Trial [in case #21CF293, set for June 27th] from its calendar. 
recess 12:30pm 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on June 28th at 11:00am

[MK] cases #21CF293 and #22CF131 called at 3:41pm 
Defendant Abigail Lea Otteson does not appear. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he is surprised at the non-appearance because an agreement has been reached in the cases.  He has not been able to reach Ms. Otteson today. 
The Court authorizes a Warrant -Body Only, returnable to Branch I only; however the Court stays the Warrants on until noon on Friday [6/24/22] to allow time for Ms. Otteson to appear.
The Court indicates that the June 27th Jury Trial date [in case #21CF293] remains on the Court's calendar at this point. 
recess 3:43pm
Status conference on June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 8:44am 
Defendant Abigail Lea Otteson in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case and the Co-Defendant's case are scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and the State's officer-witnesses are present. 
 Ms. Otteson waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:51am 

NEXT: Status Conference (likely plea/sent) on June 21st at 2:30pm

[ae] case called 11:24 AM Defendant Abigail Lea Otteson in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--not to discuss the case with co-defendant outside presence of counsel
